title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: By 2016, duty bearers have new standards, knowledge and abilities for developing improved children protection systems to prevent and respond to violence, exploitation and abuse against children., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Evaluation And Research, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, all girls and boys in 12 Eastern Caribbean countries benefit from rights-based laws, policies, programmes and institutions that provide equitable systems for positive development, lifelong learning and protection

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, duty bearers have new standards, knowledge and abilities for developing improved children protection systems to preventand respond to violence, exploitation and abuse against children.

description.narrative: Countries in the Eastern Caribbean Area have recognized the need for standards and a regulatory framework for their national child protection sector to better prevent and respond to violence, exploitation and abuse against children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2017

title.narrative: National agency responsible for child protection response initiatives in humanitarian situations.
Existence of a documented, costed model of court diversion service.

actual.value: 2016:3/3 countries (OECS/ USAID/ UNICEF assessment with findings for St Lucia, Grenada and Dominica programmes)
